occurrences.text: Ephesus, what is it that he requests prayer for? That he would have boldness, that he would open his mouth to speak with boldness as he ought to speak. Wow. He understood the command of Christ. Not only do I believe that the apostle Paul understood the command of Christ, number two, I believe that the apostle Paul understood the certainty of eternity. See, for us this evening, if we're going to come to this place that we would preach and proclaim the gospel as we ought to, that we would say as the apostle Paul that I may open my mouth boldly to make known the mystery of the gospel, that I would speak as I ought to speak, that we understand the command of Christ, but we also must understand the certainty of eternity. The wise man said in Ecclesiastes 12 in verse number five that man goes to his long home. I shared with someone recently, and I said, listen, no matter how many years we live here upon this earth, it's really only that long in light of eternity. We sometimes think about, oh man, 70, 80, 90, 100 years, it's such a long time, not compared to eternity. It's just that long. What is your life? It's but a vapor that appears for a little time and then vanisheth away. It's like a shadow. How long does your shadow stick around? Not long, not long. And so we find that the wise man,
